content: It’s a tradeoff. If you’d like, you can call them “mixed” components. I amended the article because people were taking the separation as a dogma. 90% of React users don’t ever plan to have something like a living styleguide. There is no need to make life harder for them. Even those that do, don’t need to make every component available in such tool. You can always extract the presentational part that accepts children as props from a “mixed” component. Or you can make the child component type configurable as a prop, with the container component type being the default value.
